text: Hello guys! I'm trying to send a timestamp to HubSpot via API but for some reason, the error says the date is not at midnight, this is the code I'm using:
Hi  <@UGRDVLV5K>, it wasn't in api context, so not sure if it helps, but I "midnighted" my timestamps like this:

Hi Community,

What HubSpot endpoint can be used to check if a contact exist in HubSpot before creating a new contact? I have a loging page in WP where I only want new contacts who are not in HubSpot to be created. Currently if someone has a typo or enters the wrong email address it creates a contact it HubSpot. It should first check before creating a contact.Any insight?
Nice! The timestamp is supposed to be at midnight to better represent a date, rather than a more specific point in time. Using code like above will work great

I want to create a timeline event, so I read the docs and there it has a part: `creating an Event Type` all good and well. I know the `appid` and the `HSAPIkey`, but where do I find the `youUserId`. All I am able to find is the `username`.

Found it. I was using the test client and I needed to be in the developer edition.
I think the differences are pretty confusing:
• The developer edition has all the things I need, except workflows
• The test client has workflows, but not the developer tools
Thank you very much :heart: it worked!

Hey, <@UEZJ74UN8>. If you have a properly formatted email value, you can use this endpoint: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/get_contact_by_email>.

You could also use the more general contact search endpoint (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/search_contacts>) if you want to also search for contacts by name or company name.

Keep in mind that these requests must be made server-side.

Hey, <@ULGT5RY4U>. <@UEZJ74UN8> was able to resolve his issue by using the Tracking Code API methods (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/tracking_code_api/tracking_code_overview>).

Could you describe the issue you’re experiencing in more detail? Do you have any example pages or links to contacts who do not show analytics activities despite you passing the `hutk`?
